epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete for construction applications including residential, commercial foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern exceeding 0.1%
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging

data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required
data_quality.background_data_sources: Assessed as good or very good

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Module A1 - raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, electricity generation
system_boundaries.core_processes: Modules A2 and A3 - transport to core processes, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), waste and wastewater treatment
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Modules A4 to D - distribution, installation, construction waste, deconstruction, transport and treatment of waste, recycling benefits

transport.average_transport_distance: 11.77 km from manufacturing gate to site

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.method: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

primary_indicators.ADPF: 1642 MJ net calorific value per m³

resource_use.PERE: 54.6 MJ net calorific value per m³
resource_use.PERT: 54.6 MJ net calorific value per m³
resource_use.PENRE: 1685 MJ net calorific value per m³
resource_use.PENRT: 1685 MJ net calorific value per m³
resource_use.RSE: 17.2 MJ net calorific value per m³

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Certain impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
